content:
Congratulations on getting your passport renewed!

To enter Japan, you'll need the following required documents:

1. **Valid Passport**: You've already taken care of this! Make sure your passport is valid for at least six months beyond your planned departure date from Japan.
2. **Visa (depending on your nationality)**: Depending on your country of citizenship, you might need a visa to enter Japan. Check the Japanese government's website or consult with the Japanese embassy or consulate in your home country to determine if you need a visa. Some nationalities are eligible for a visa exemption, which allows them to stay in Japan for up to 90 days for tourism, business, or transit purposes.
3. **Return or Onward Ticket**: You may be asked to show a return ticket or a ticket for onward travel from Japan when you arrive. This is not always required, but it's a good idea to have one to avoid any potential issues.
4. **Completed Arrival/Departure Card**: You'll receive an arrival/departure card on the plane or at the airport. Fill it out and submit it to the immigration officer when you arrive in Japan.

That's it! If you're a US citizen, you don't need a visa for tourism or business stays up to 90 days. However, it's always a good idea to check the Japanese government's website or consult with the Japanese embassy or consulate in your home country for the most up-to-date information.

Remember to also make photocopies of your important documents (e.g., passport, ID, and travel insurance) and leave a copy with a trusted friend or family member in case of an emergency.

Enjoy your trip to Japan!
